name: Config
info:
An input to this subflow will get the configuration to be saved to disk.

On startup, this node outputs the loaded configuration

# PlanktoScope Help
This Node will read the content of the file named **config.txt** containing all the input placeholders.

name: Image control
Encapsulate config
func:
msg.payload = {
	"action": "update_config",
	"config": {
    	"description": {
    		"sample_project": "Project's name",
    		"sample_id": "Sample ID",
    		"sample_uuid": "Sample UUID (Autogenerated)",
    		"sample_ship": "Ship's name",
    		"sample_operator": "Operator's name",
    		"sample_sampling_gear": "Sampling gear used",
    		"sample_concentrated_sample_volume": "Volume of concentrated sample, in mL",
    		"sample_total_volume": "Total volume filtered by the net used, in L",
    		"sample_dilution_factor": "Dilution factor of the sample, 0.5 if diluted by 2, 2 if concentrated by 2",
    		"sample_speed_through_water": "Speed of the boat through water when sampling, in kts",
    		"acq_id": "Acquisition ID",
    		"acq_uuid": "Acquisition UUID (Autogenerated)",
    		"acq_instrument": "Instrument type",
    		"acq_instrument_id": "Instrument ID",
    		"acq_celltype": "Flow cell dimension thickness, in m",
    		"acq_minimum_mesh": "Minimum filtration mesh size, in m",
    		"acq_maximum_mesh": "Maximum filtration mesh size, in m",
    		"acq_min_esd": "",
    		"acq_max_esd": "",
    		"acq_volume": "Pumped volume, in mL",
		    "acq_imaged_volume": "Total imaged volume, in mL",
    		"acq_magnification": "Optical magnification",
    		"acq_fnumber_objective": "Focal length of the objective, in mm",
    		"acq_camera_name": "Name of the camera used",
    		"acq_nb_frame": "Number of picture taken",
            "acq_local_datetime": "Instrument local datetime",
            "acq_camera_resolution": "Resolution of the images",
            "acq_camera_iso": "ISO Number of the images",
            "acq_camera_shutter_speed": "Shutter speed of the images, in s",
            "acq_software": "Software version number",
    		"object_date": "Sample collection date (or beginning if using a net)",
    		"object_time": "Sample collection time (or beginning if using a net)",
    		"object_lat": "Sample collection latitude (or beginning if using a net)",
    		"object_lon": "Sample collection longitude (or beginning if using a net)",
    		"object_depth_min": "Sample collection minimal depth, in m",
    		"object_depth_max": "Sample collection maximum depth, in m",
    		"process_pixel": "Pixel imaging resolution, in m/pixel",
    		"process_datetime": "Segmentation timestamp",
    		"process_id": "Segmentation ID",
    		"process_uuid": "Segmentation UUID (Autogenerated)",
    		"process_source": "Code source link of the executed code",
    		"process_commit": "Version reference of the executed code",
    		"sample_gear_net_opening": "Sample mouth opening dimension, in mm",
    		"object_date_end": "Sample end collection date when using a net",
    		"object_time_end": "Sample end collection time when using a net",
    		"object_lat_end": "Sample end collection latitude when using a net",
    		"object_lon_end": "Sample end collection longitude when using a net",
    	},
		"sample_project": global.get("sample_project"),
		"sample_id": global.get("sample_project") + "_" + global.get("sample_id"),
		"sample_ship": global.get("sample_ship"),
		"sample_operator": global.get("sample_operator"),
		"sample_sampling_gear": global.get("sample_sampling_gear"),
		"sample_concentrated_sample_volume": global.get("sample_concentrated_sample_volume"),
		"sample_total_volume": global.get("sample_total_volume"),
		"sample_dilution_factor": global.get("sample_dilution_factor"),
		"sample_speed_through_water": global.get("sample_speed_through_water"),

		"acq_id": global.get("sample_project") + "_" + global.get("sample_id")+ "_" + global.get("acq_id"),
		"acq_instrument": global.get("acq_instrument"),
		"acq_instrument_id": global.get("acq_instrument_id"),
		"acq_celltype": global.get("acq_celltype"),
		"acq_minimum_mesh": global.get("acq_minimum_mesh"),
		"acq_maximum_mesh": global.get("acq_maximum_mesh"),
		"acq_min_esd": global.get("acq_min_esd"),
		"acq_max_esd": global.get("acq_max_esd"),
		"acq_volume": global.get("acq_volume"),
		"acq_imaged_volume": global.get("acq_imaged_volume"),
		"acq_magnification": global.get("acq_magnification"),
		"acq_fnumber_objective": global.get("acq_fnumber_objective"),
		"acq_camera": global.get("acq_camera"),
		"acq_nb_frame": global.get("nb_frame"),
		"acq_software": global.get("acq_software"),

		"object_date": global.get("object_date"),
		"object_time": global.get("object_time"),
		"object_lat": global.get("object_lat"),
		"object_lon": global.get("object_lon"),
		"object_depth_min": global.get("object_depth_min"),
		"object_depth_max": global.get("object_depth_max"),

		"process_pixel": global.get("process_pixel"),
		"process_source": global.get("process_source"),
		"process_commit": global.get("process_commit")
	}
};

if (msg.payload.config.sample_sampling_gear.startsWith("net")) {
	msg.payload.config["sample_gear_net_opening"] = global.get("sample_gear_net_opening")
	msg.payload.config["object_date_end"] = global.get("object_date_end")
	msg.payload.config["object_time_end"] = global.get("object_time_end")
	msg.payload.config["object_lat_end"] = global.get("object_lat_end")
	msg.payload.config["object_lon_end"] = global.get("object_lon_end")
}

if ( msg.send == true){
	return [msg, msg]
}
else{
	return [msg, null]
}

name: img_counter
imaged volume calc
info:
### Focusing
##### focus.py `nb_step` `orientation`

- `nb_step` : **integer** (from 1 to 100000) - number of step to perform by the stage (about 31um/step)
- `orientation` : **string** - orientation of the focus either `up` or `down`

Example:

    python3.7 $HOME/PlanktoScope/scripts/focus.py 650 up

name: acq_volume calc
info:
### Focusing
##### focus.py `nb_step` `orientation`

- `nb_step` : **integer** (from 1 to 100000) - number of step to perform by the stage (about 31um/step)
- `orientation` : **string** - orientation of the focus either `up` or `down`

Example:

    python3.7 $HOME/PlanktoScope/scripts/focus.py 650 up

name: check tab
obj_counter
func:
obj_counter = flow.get('obj_counter')
obj_counter = obj_counter + 1
flow.set('obj_counter', obj_counter)
msg.payload = obj_counter
msg.topic = "object count"
return msg

name: prepare segmentation

Refresh
label: Update acquisition's folder list
tooltip: Refresh the list of previous acquisitions

name: update segmentation_list
Update message
format:
You can choose here in which folder(s) you want the segmentation script to run. A few details though:
The segmentation is run recursively in all folders. So if you select a top level folder, the segmentation will be run in all subfolders.
Also, you will be able to chose wether for force the segmentation for folders in which it has run already.

name: remove common
Stream Segmented object
format: Latest object segmented:

name: Logs
format:
The PlanktoScope software application consists of three components: a Node-RED dashboard which provides the user interface you're using; a Hardware Controller which executes commands sent from the Node-RED dashboard for hardware control and image acquisition; and a Segmenter which processes an acquired dataset of images and isolates objects from those images. Each component has its own independent log of messages, managed separately from the logs for the other components.

All three components have live-updating logs which you can monitor. Additionally, the Hardware Controller and the Segmenter also save all of their log messages to files which you can browse and download. Those software components create a new log file each time they start, and the name of the log file includes the time in the PlanktoScope's clock when the software component started. However, if your PlanktoScope's clock is usually wrong, it makes the log files difficult to navigate. This will be fixed in a future version of the software.

If you need to share your logs with other people (e.g. on Slack or GitHub), you should open the "Downloadable Logs" links, and then you can select one file or multiple log files for downloading as a zip archive.

  • Node-RED:
    • Live-updating logs (log in as the "pi" user with the "pi" user's password)
    • Certain errors generated in the dashboard: see the "Dashboard errors" panel on this page.
  • Hardware Controller:
    • Live-updating logs (log in as the "pi" user with the "pi" user's password)
    • Downloadable logs
  • Segmenter:
    • Live-updating logs
    • Downloadable logs
  • Operating System:
    • Live-updating logs (log in as the "pi" user with the "pi" user's password)

command: df -h | grep /dev/root | awk -F ' ' '{print $5}' | tr -d % | tr "\n$" "\ " |  sed 's/,/./' | tr -d " "

name: Metrics panel
format:
The instrument's system time is different from your web browser's time by {{drift}}. As a result, timestamps in your datasets will be incorrect. Additionally, system metrics will not be recorded or shown correctly. Additionally, you will see incorrectly-aligned graphs in the metrics below.

Please change the instrument's system time or your web browser's time to accurate values.

Loading system metrics, please wait...

name: Get system time
Get system time
Prepare timestamp
func:
msg.payload = ('@' + msg.payload.timestamp).slice(0, -3);
return msg;

format:
Browser Time

{{time}}

name: Information
format:
Changing one of these values will cause the Python hardware controller to restart, to reload the new hardware configuration.

Warning: selecting a hardware version from the dropdown menu below will also overwrite all of your hardware settings, including your camera white balance settings.

If you are not sure, you probably should not be touching anything here!

name: Save global
func:

return msg;

tooltip: Object size in m / pixel. 0 will remove this calibration.
